atelier.title: My workshop
atelier.description:
Looking for a part, a watch, or something else related to antiques? Or your watch is not working anymore? Come and see the workshop!
My workshop is open from Monday to Thursday between 2:30 PM and 5:00 PM.
I am located in Geneva, at Rue des Corps-Saints 10, 1201 Geneva.

exposition.title: Exposition
exposition.description:
In 2018, I founded a small permanent exhibition called The Watchmaking Curiosities. I invite you to discover my world and share my passion for watchmaking.
The exhibition is located in a small village in the canton of Geneva. It is open to the public and you can visit it by appointment. Maximum 5 people per visit.

cabinotiers.title: What is a cabinotier?
cabinotiers.description: The word 'cabinotier' is of Geneva origin. Combining technical precision and innovation, the art of the cabinotiers of Saint-Gervais has contributed to the distinction of Geneva. Since the 18th century, the word 'cabinotier' has grouped together the trades related to watchmaking, such as case assemblers, guillocheurs, engravers, setters, gilders, and enamelers. They worked at home or in tiny 'cabins' under the roofs of houses.
